title: Orecchiette with Cauliflower and Tomatoes
introduction: This classic Italian dish combines tender orecchiette pasta with a rich tomato sauce and hearty cauliflower. A traditional recipe from Sicily and Puglia, it uses simple, fresh ingredients to create a comforting and flavorful meal. Perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion, this dish can be finished with toasted bread crumbs or your favorite grated cheese.
ingredients: 3 pounds plum tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped or 1 (28-ounce) can imported Italian peeled tomatoes, with their juice, chopped
1 medium cauliflower, trimmed and cut into florets
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: In a skillet large enough to hold all of the ingredients, cook the garlic in 1⁄3 cup of the olive oil over medium heat until golden. Add the tomatoes and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook 10 minutes.
Stir in the cauliflower. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the cauliflower is very tender, about 25 minutes. Crush some of the cauliflower with the back of a spoon.
In a small skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the bread crumbs and anchovies, if using. Cook, stirring until the crumbs are toasted and the oil is absorbed.

Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add the pasta and salt to taste. Cook, stirring frequently, until the pasta is al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta, reserving a little of the cooking water.
Toss the pasta with the tomato and cauliflower sauce. Add a little of the cooking water if needed. Sprinkle with the bread crumbs and serve immediately.
variations: Substitute grated cheese for the toasted bread crumbs.
Add more vegetables, such as broccoli or bell peppers, for additional flavor and nutrition.
